column4: use that pro i posted a link to ^^ up there... then follow the last three steps on this page: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=327781

if all goes correctly, bootpart will save the boot info from the ubuntu partition, to a file on the c drive, then create an entry in boot.ini  (you must have grub installed on the ubuntu partition NOT THE MBR) FOR THAT TO WORK CORRECTLY
just make sure you have the grub loader installed on the UBUNTU PARTITION before running bootpart
